item.title: Google Photos introduces an AI search feature, ‘Ask Photos’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
The AI upgrade will make finding the right content more intuitive and less of a manual search process.

item.title: Apple touts stopping $1.8BN in App Store fraud last year in latest pitch to developers
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Apple released new data about anti-fraud measures related to its operation of the iOS App Store on Tuesday morning, trumpeting a claim that it stopped over $7 billion in “potentially fraudulent transactions” across the four years between 2020 and 2023. More than $1.8 billion of that total was stopped in 2023, per Apple, which is […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Expedia starts testing AI-powered features for search and travel planning
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Online travel agency Expedia is testing an AI assistant that bolsters features like search, itinerary building, trip planning, and real-time travel updates.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Inside TabaPay’s drama-filled decision to abandon its plans to buy Synapse’s assets
item.dc:creator: Carrie Andrews
item.description:
Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! This week, we look at the drama around TabaPay deciding to not buy Synapse’s assets, as well as stocks dropping for a couple of fintechs, Monzo raising even more funds, and more! Sign up here to get Fintech in your inbox every Tuesday at 7 a.m. PT! The big story There was […]

item.title: Threat actor scraped Dell support tickets, including customer phone numbers
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
The person who claimed to have stolen the physical addresses of 49 million Dell customers appears to have taken more data from a different Dell portal, TechCrunch has learned. The newly compromised data includes names, phone numbers and email addresses of Dell customers. This personal data is contained in customer “service reports,” which also include […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: On Elon’s whim, X now treats ‘cisgender’ as a slur
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
If you write the words “cis” or “cisgender” on X, you might be served this full-screen message: “This post contains language that may be considered a slur by X and could be used in a harmful manner in violation of our rules,” the warning says. You can continue to publish the post or delete it. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta is shutting down Workplace, its enterprise communications business
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Facebook once had big ambitions to be a major player in enterprise communication and productivity, but today the social network’s parent company Meta will be closing a very significant chapter in that story. TechCrunch has learned that Meta is shuttering Workplace, a version of Facebook that had been built to enable communication among business teams […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta’s Oversight Board overturns takedown decision for Pakistan child abuse documentary
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
The Oversight Board has overturned Meta's decision to take down a documentary revealing the identities of child abuse victims in Pakistan.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
The keynote kicks off at 10 a.m. PT on Tuesday and will offer glimpses into the latest versions of Android, Wear OS and Android TV.

item.title: AWS CEO Adam Selipsky steps down
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Adam Selipsky is stepping down from his role as CEO of Amazon Web Services, Amazon has confirmed to TechCrunch.  In a memo shared internally by Amazon CEO Andy Jassy and published this morning to the company’s blog, Jassy said that AWS sales chief Matt Garman will be promoted to CEO. Garman previously headed AWS’ EC2 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: David Sacks reveals Glue, the AI company he’s been teasing on his All In podcast
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
VC and podcaster David Sacks has revealed a new AI chat app called Glue that fixes "Slack channel fatigue," he says.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: After surpassing $100M in ARR, Harness grabs a $150M line of credit
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
Harness isn’t founder Jyoti Bansal’s first startup. He sold AppDynamics to Cisco for $3.7 billion in 2017, the week it was supposed to go public. His latest venture has raised $425 million, per Crunchbase. On Tuesday, Harness announced $150 million in debt financing, essentially a line of credit that the company can draw on as […]

item.title: Sona, a frontline workforce management platform, raises $27.5M with eyes on US expansion
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Sona, a workforce management platform for frontline employees, has raised $27.5 million in a Series A round of funding. More than two-thirds of the U.S. workforce are reportedly in frontline jobs, which might be anything from customer service and healthcare to retail environments and hospitality. But managing this vast workforce, ensuring roles are filled and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Uber to acquire Foodpanda’s Taiwan unit from Delivery Hero for $950M in cash
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Uber Technologies announced Tuesday that it will buy the Taiwan unit of Delivery Hero’s Foodpanda for $950 million in cash. The deal is part of Uber Eats’ strategy to expand in Asia, specifically by strengthening its position in Taiwan. On the other hand, it also underscores Delivery Hero’s ongoing retreat from that same market: The sale […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Paris-based VC firm Blisce launches climate tech fund with a target of $160M
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Paris-based Blisce has become the latest VC firm to launch a fund dedicated to climate tech. It plans to raise as much as €150M (about $162M).

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Maad raises $3.2M seed amid B2B e-commerce sector turbulence in Africa
item.dc:creator: Annie Njanja
item.description:
Maad, a B2B e-commerce startup based in Senegal, has secured $3.2 million debt-equity funding to bolster its growth in the western Africa country and to explore fresh opportunities in the wider Francophone region. The seed round was led by Ventures Platform, with participation from Seedstars International Ventures, Reflect Ventures, Oui Capital, Launch Africa, Voltron Capital […]
